Page.Name: fight
Page.text: Eternal Lands Help
Skills
Fighting:
The
fighting skills are attack and defense. To start
raising these skills, you must fight a lot. You can fight
with animals like rabbits, beavers, rats, deer and such,
and later monsters like goblins, skeletons, etc. Another
option is going onto special PK (player killing) maps
and fighting other players.
Beginners
should try to fight some of the weaker
creatures in this game such as rabbits, rats, and
beavers.
While
fighting you get injured or sometimes killed. To
regain health, make sure that your food level (the yellow
bar) is positive. To do this you must eat. You can eat
bread, fruits and veggies, and cooked meat. You can buy
your food at the taverns, find it in bags on the ground
on Isla Prima, or harvest the veggies yourself. You can
eat it by clicking on the pointing finger icon at the
bottom and then click on the food.
To
heal during you first levels, you can go back on
Isla Prima and talk to the Tutorial NPC.
To
heal even faster, you can buy or make healing potions
and drink them. Another option is to cast healing spells
on yourself.
When
you are dead, you respawn near the campfire on Isla
Prima. When your levels are a little higher, you are sent
to the underworld. To leave the underworld, go north
until you see large steps with candles on each side
leading to a red glowing portal. Walk up close and click
on the arch above it to exit.

Page.Name: harv
Page.text: Eternal Lands Help
Skills
Harvesting:
Harvesting
is used to get resources like flowers, ore,
gems, food and such. To start this skill, simply find a
flower and click on it and wait. You see a message "You
started to harvest xxx" where xxx is the name of the
flower you clicked on. Open your inventory with a click
on the bag icon or press CTRL-i and you should see that
you get more and more flowers.
You
will get harvesting xp for 120 harvests maximum per
ingame hour (to see what time it is ingame, click on the
clock on the right of your screen). A red message tells
you when you have reached this limit. You can, of course,
continue harvesting to get items, but you won't get any
harvesting xp for those.
While
harvesting different kinds of flowers you may find
out that you get a different amount of harvesting xp for
each flower type. Items that are hard to get, give more
xp than items that are easy to get. For beginners it's
vegetables to harvest. It will take longer than flowers,
but vegetables give the best harvesting xp. An extra
benefit to harvesting vegetables is that it is food. No
need to buy it anymore. And vegetables are a source of
money, because you can sell them to taverns.
There
are also harvesting events which may occur from
time to time. Some effect you negatively, some
positively. For example, you can get stung by a bee
(losing health), the Queen of Nature blesses you with
extra harvesting xp, or you find a bag with a few gold
coins. These events stop the autoharvester. You must
start harvesting again by clicking on the resource you
want to harvest.
To
stop harvesting, click again on the resource you are
harvesting or simply walk away.

Page.Name: manu
Page.text: Eternal Lands Help
Skills
Manufacturing:
To
start making items, you need a needle, thread, and
furs. While hunting rabbits, keep the furs and sell only
the meat. Then go to a General Store, Lakeside has one
for example, and buy some thread and one needle.
Lakeside
is the village at the docks on White Stone map.
To go there from Isla Prima, go south to the docks and
click on the flag on the ship. Press TAB key to see a
map. General Stores are the green dots on it.
Make
sure you have food in your inventory. You can't
manufacture when you are hungry (yellow bar below 0) so
keep your food level positive.
The
first thing to make is warm fur gloves. You need 3
brown rabbit furs and 2 thread. Make sure that you have
the needle in your inventory too. Open the manufacturing
window by clicking on the "hammer and anvil" icon on the
bottom. Then click 3 times on the rabbit furs, 2 times on
the thread. Now click the "Mix" button and wait. And,
hopefully, you have made your first pair of fur gloves.
**Note**:
You will sometimes fail to make an item. This
is normal. Just try again. Now make as many fur gloves as
you can get rabbit furs until your manufacture level is
up to 4 or 5. You can sell the gloves to any General
Store to make some money.
Now
it's time to make yourself a fur hat. Go on the
White Stone map and try to kill a white rabbit. Tirnwood
Vale (click Tab to see where that is) is good place to
find white rabbits. You will also need to get 3 beaver
furs, you can find beavers on Isla Prima. Then all you
need to do is buy 3 threads and you have the ingredients
for "teh one hat".
To
make the hat, be sure that you have the needle in your
inventory, then open the manufacturing window(hammer and
anvil icon) and click 3 times on the beaver furs, 3 times
on the thread and 1 time on the white rabbit fur. Then
click "Mix" button, wait, and pray that you have now made
a fur hat.
When
you can make fur hats easily, try to get some wolf
and fox furs. Ask players who are training(fighting) on
foxes or wolfs if they can sell you a few furs. Of course
you can try to kill some wolves and foxes yourself, but
they are much harder to kill than rabbits or rats, so
instead of committing suicide, better ask other players
for furs.
You
need 3 wolf furs, 2 fox furs, and 5 thread to make a
fur cloak. Don't forget you need your needle and food in
your inventory as well. Follow the same procedure as
above to start to make the cloak.
And
now you have a set of fur clothes: gloves, hat, and
cloak.
Now you can wear them. Congratulations!
The
next useful things to make are leather gloves. You
need 4 leather and 4 thread. Leather can be bought at
General Stores. Have your needle in your inventory and
eat some food, open the manufacture window, click 4 times
on leather, 4 times on thread and then the "Mix" button.
Expect to fail and even lose the ingredients. After a
few tries, you should now have a leather glove, which is
very useful. Leather gloves are needed to harvest sulphur,
pick cactus, and you can even use it as a weapon!

Page.Name: alch
Page.text: Eternal Lands Help
Skills
Alchemy:
Alchemy
is the art of making essences and metal bars. So
let's make fire essences to start out with, they are easy
to make and you can sell them to magic shops or players
to make money.
Fire essences are used for metal smelting, to make metal
bars and other metal stuff.
You
need sulphur, red roses, and red snapdragons to make a
fire essence. Both flowers can be found on the Valley of
the Dwarves map, on the eastern side of the river hidden
in the woods(you might have to search for them a bit).
To go to the Valley of the Dwarves from Isla Prima, go
south to the docks, click on the flag on the ship. Now
you are at the Lakeside docks. Go to the second ship ,
click on the flag (has a deer on it) and you are at the
docks of Desert Pines. The second ship (has a bear on the
flag) brings you to the Valley of the Dwarves. Harvest
the flowers and store them at Molgor, the storage in the
town.
Sulphur
can be found in Crystal Caves in the middle of the
Desert Pines map. To go there from the Valley of the
Dwarves, go back to the docks, click on the flag with the
deer on it. The cave is located in the mountains in the
middle of the map. To harvest sulphur, you must wear
leather gloves. Read the manufacture walkthrough how to
make some, or you can buy them from the White Stone City
blacksmith (purple dot), or buy them from other players.
Once you find and harvest the sulphur, you can store it at
the Desert Pines storage npc named Grim.
Now
that you have stored the flowers and sulphur, get some
food to have in your inventory. Go back to Grim and
withdraw 10 red roses, 10 red snapdragons and 10 sulphur.
Make sure that you're not hungry because you can't make
essences when your food level is not positive. Open the
manufacturing window (hammer and anvil icon at the
bottom) and click on one rose, one snapdragon and one
sulphur. Then click the "Mix" button and wait. And
hopefully you'll have made your first fire essence. It's
possible to fail, if that happens just try again.
Now
make some more fire essences. When you are done,
search for the magic shops in Grahms Village(west of the
tavern) or in White Stone City on the White Stone/Lakeside
map. Enter and sell them and you now know how to make
easy money.
Now
start to make tons of fire essences. Look very
carefully at your inventory. If there is suddenly a
second box with a fire essence, that does not mean that
the first box is full. Check both essences with the "eye"
cursor (click on the "eye" icon at the bottom) to find
out what they are. One of them is an enriched fire
essence and can be sold to players for BIG amount of
money. There is a very small chance to make an enriched
essence, so if you get one, you are really really lucky!

Page.Name: magc
Page.text: Eternal Lands Help
Skills
Magic:
Magic
is the art of casting spells. To do so, you need
sigils and essences. You can buy sigils in magic shops on
the White Stone map. Once you have bought a sigil, it
shows up in your magic window (click on the icon with the
magic wand), not in your inventory, and stays forever.
Essences can be bought at magic shops too, but they are
single use. You can also make your own essences using
alchemy or buy them from other players.
To
start with magic, go to the magic shop in Grahms
Village and buy the "Health" sigil. Then find the magic
shop in White Stone City and get the "Increase" sigil.
There you should buy a few health essences too. And now
you are ready to cast heal spells. So fight some animals
to get injured and heal yourself!
Now
click on the icon with the magic wand at the bottom
and you should see the 2 sigils. First click on the
Increase sigil, then on the Health sigil. Make sure that
you have the health essences in your inventory, then
click the "Cast" button. If you don't fail, you should
have recovered 10 material points now (red bar). And you
lost 5 ethereal points (blue bar). Each spell uses a
certain amount of ethereal points (also known as "mana").
When your ethereal points are less than 5, you can't
cast the heal spell, you must wait, until you have
regenerated more ethereal points. Also regenerating
ethereal points needs a positive food level.
You
can also drink mana potions or potions of spirit
restoration to regain Ethereal points. Mira, the potion
seller in the market place in White Stone City, sells
them, or you can buy them from other players who can make
them. To train magic, just go and buy the cheap mana
potions, cast spells, then drink the potions when your
mana points are too low to cast any more spells. That's a
nice way to train magic. And make sure to keep your
empty vials, you will need them later!

Page.Name: pots
Page.text: Eternal Lands Help
Skills
Potions
Lets
start with making healing potions. When you drink
them, you regain 5 material points (red bar), so you can
use then when fighting creatures.
To
make all potions, you need empty vials. The easiest
way to get some, is to buy them from Harvy, who is
located in the south of the Kamara Desert. They cost
3 gold coins and 5 quartz.
Then
go back to Grahm's Village, to the western most
house with the vegetable patch in the garden. Near the
house are sunflowers, pick a few and pick some vegetables
as well. After that, buy some wine from the Tavern and
you are ready to make your own potions.
Make
sure that your food level is positive, then open the
manufacturing window by clicking on the hammer and anvil
icon at the bottom. Click once on a vial, wine and
sunflower. Click the "Mix" button and wait. If you don't
fail, you will have your first self-made healing potion.

Page.Name: summ
Page.text: Eternal Lands Help
Skills
Summoning
Summoning
lets you bring creatures to life in this world
for a limited time. They will follow you wherever you go
on the actual map until they die.
First,
you need a dead rabbit. Just go and kill one. You
need 1 brown rabbit fur, 1 bone and 1 meat. Buy a life
essence in one of the magic shops, make sure that your
ethereal points are not 0 (blue bar) and that's it. Now
find a quiet place. Never summon at crowded places like
storages and beam/wraith.
Open
the manufacture window by clicking on the hammer and
anvil icon at the bottom. Click once on the brown rabbit
fur, the meat, the bone and the life essence. Now click
the "Mix" button and wait. If you dont fail, there is now
a rabbit hopping near you. Now walk away and it will
follow you.

Page.Name: crft
Page.text: Eternal Lands Help
Skills
Crafting
To
start getting the first levels in crafting all you
need is an artificial nexus 1 (see Wraith). Go to Desert
Pines and look for some cotton in the Corren Village
area and harvest it.
Once
you have about 30 cotton open the manufacture
window by clicking on the hammer and anvil icon at
the bottom. Click 5 times on the cotton and then
click the "Mix" button and wait.
If you dont fail, you'll make 1 thread; if you need food
there are usually vegetables growing near the cotton.
Go on making thread to gain your first crafting levels,
and keep the thread for when you train manufacturing.
To
start crafting jewels, you need a lot of knowledge.
Meaning you must read books first before you can start.
Go to Tarsengaard and enter the magic school. But beware
of the armored goblins on that map! You can enter
Tarsengaard both from The Valley of the Dwarves or from
the White Stone maps. Find Itilli in the registry room,
that's on the left hand side just after entering the
entrance hall. Buy from her the Generic Rings and Gold
Rings books and read them. Yes, you will start with
making simple gold rings.
While
reading, make sure, that your artificial nexus is 1
(see Wraith). Then go and get some gold bars, make them
(alchemy) or buy them from other players. You will also
need some fire essences. Make them (alchemy) or buy them
from other players or magic shops on the White Stone map.
And last you need a ring mold. The magic shop in Portland
(yellow dot on map) sells it. There you can get some
other items needed for crafting too like gem sanders, gem
cutters and such.
When
you are done reading both books, have the gold bars,
fire essences, and ring mold in your inventory, you are
ready to start. Don't forget to grab some food.
Now
open the manufacture window (the icon with the hammer
and anvil at the bottom), click 2 times on a gold bar, 3
times on a fire essence, and then click the "Mix"
button. Wait, and hopefully you will have made your first
gold ring. To make silver rings, go to Itilli and buy
the Silver Rings book and read it. And so forth. The gold
and silver rings you make now are ingredients in making
the magic rings we use such as teleport rings, damage
rings, and disengagement rings.
As
you now have found out, crafting is a very expensive
and time consuming skill normally started by the more
advanced players.

Page.name: engn
Page.text: Eternal Lands Help
Skills
Engineering
Engineering
is an advanced skill, used to create several
devices like landmines and visors or making dangerous
substances.
If you are new to the game, it is advised that you level
up in other skills before you start this one. For most
of the items you'll need the support of quite high
skills and you'll also have to travel to a distant and
dangerous place in order to buy the expensive books
you'll need.
Start
engineering by making some ashes. All you need for
this are branches and fire essences.
You can find branches on the ground in the woods, for
example on Isla Prima or in the Evergreen Woods in Desert
Pines; fire essences can be made (alchemy) or you could
buy them from other players or magic shops on the White
Stone map. Once you have the branches and the essences,
you can start making ashes: open the manufacturing window
by clicking on the hammer and anvil icon, then to add the
ingredients click 3 times on the branches, once on a fire
essence, and then click the "Mix" button.
Wait, and hopefully you will have made ashes!
Continue
making ashes to gain your first engineering
levels, and save them in your storage as they can be used
later on for making some more advanced items.
If
you want to start making something else after ashes,
you'll need to read books. The bookseller you'll need to
find is Neculce, located in North Redmoon. North Redmoon
is a map on the continent of Irilion and deadly monsters
live there. The books you need to start off with are
"Book of Nails" and "Book of Rope" which will both cost
a total of 8k gold coins.
After
reading the books, The next 2 items you can try to
make are ropes and nails. You'll need some thread for the
ropes and iron bars for the nails. You can make thread
(crafting), or buy it from players or general stores.
When you have the thread, open the manufacture window,
click 5 times on the thread and then click the "Mix"
button to make your first rope. Ropes can also be sold
to the general stores.
For
making nails you need iron bars and a hammer. You can
make the bars yourself or buy them from players, and the
hammer is sold by the blacksmith in White Stone City.
Once you have the bars and the hammer (and some food)
open the manufacturing window, click 2 times on the iron
bars and then click the "Mix" button to make some nails.
